intro: Castanopsis cuspidata var. lutchuensis, commonly known as the Lushan tallow tree, is a species of evergreen tree native to China. It belongs to the Fagaceae family, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its dense, glossy foliage. The tree produces small, spiky acorns that are an important food source for various wildlife species. It thrives in humid, subtropical climates and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soils. This variant is distinguished by its unique leaf shape and acorn morphology compared to other members of the Castanopsis genus.
